benchmark_details.name: VLBiasBench (A Comprehensive Benchmark for Evaluating Bias in Large Vision-Language Models)
benchmark_details.overview: VLBiasBench is a comprehensive benchmark designed to evaluate biases in Large Vision-Language Models (LVLMs) across multiple categories, using a dataset that includes 128,342 samples generated from 46,848 high-quality images and various questions.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive evaluation framework for assessing biases in Large Vision-Language Models (LVLMs).
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Current benchmark may still lack comprehensive coverage of all bias categories.

data.source: Generated synthetic data using Stable Diffusion XL model.
data.annotation: Synthesized images matched with bias-related questions, categorized into open-ended and close-ended types.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on sentiment analysis of the textual responses from LVLMs.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate a greater degree of bias.
methodology.validation: Results validated through extensive evaluations on multiple models.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Evaluation includes various demographic factors across multiple bias categories.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Strict controls over prompt safety to prevent generation of NSFW or offensive content.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Data utilized from CC-BY-NC-SA 4.0 licensed datasets.
